configboolean.name: allow_accounts
configboolean.desc: Should we allow users to add remote accounts?

configswitch.name: allow_folders
configswitch.desc: Should we allow users to use folders at all? NOTE: setting this to false will mean there is no place to save sent-mail or postponed messages, along with the obvious effects of restricting the user to their INBOX.

configboolean.name: allow_resume_all
configboolean.desc: If this is true, the user will be able to resume any message in any mailbox. Otherwise, only messages marked as 'drafts' can be resumed.

configboolean.name: allow_view_source
configboolean.desc: If this is true, then there will be a 'Message Source' link in the parts list of every message, allowing the user to view the entire raw message, or to download it and save it to disk.

configswitch.name: select_view
configswitch.desc: Allow user to select the application view mode on login?

configswitch.name: server_list
configswitch.desc: Should we display a list of servers (defined in config/servers.php) for users to choose from? The options are 'shown', 'hidden', and 'none'. If the server list is hidden then you can use the 'preferred' mechanism to auto-select from it based on an HTTP virtualhost or another piece of data. If it is shown, the user will be able to pick from any of the options. If none, no server list will be shown and the defaults will be used unless another mechanism changes them.

configlist.name: fixed_folders
configlist.desc: A comma separated list of folders that can't be modified (deleted, renamed, etc) by the user, e.g.: "Drafts, Trash". (The mailbox value must be encoded in the UTF7-IMAP charset; see RFC 3501 [5.1.3])

configboolean.name: cache_folders
configboolean.desc: If using IMAP, should we cache the list of folders so that the list does not need to be rebuilt on every page load? If set to true, note that any folders created on the server during an IMP session that are NOT created via IMP will not be displayed until the next login. If IMP will be the exclusive means of accessing the mail server, or you are not concerned about this behavior, this setting should be set to true.

configstring.name: words
configstring.desc: If filtering of message content is turned on, where should we find the list of words to filter out?

configstring.name: replacement
configstring.desc: What should we replace filtered words with?

configswitch.name: reporting
configswitch.desc: Should we display a 'report this message as spam' link?

configswitch.name: reporting
configswitch.desc: Should we display a 'report this message as innocent' link?

configboolean.name: add_printedby
configboolean.desc: Should we add a "Printed By" header to the top of all printed messages?

configboolean.name: prepend_header
configboolean.desc: Should we include the contents of imp/config/header.php in the headers of every message sent?

configboolean.name: append_trailer
configboolean.desc: Should we append the contents of imp/config/trailer.txt to the end of every message sent?

configboolean.name: allow_receipts
configboolean.desc: Can the user request a return receipt?

configboolean.name: use_vfs
configboolean.desc: Should we use the Horde VFS system for storing uploaded attachments?

configswitch.name: link_attachments
configswitch.desc: Should we allow the users to send attachments as links?

configinteger.name: attach_size_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total size of attachments per message (in bytes)? Set this value to 0 for no limit. [Note, the maximum allowable size of any individual attachment is set via the PHP 'upload_max_filesize' parameter - see imp/docs/INSTALL]

configinteger.name: attach_count_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total number of attachments per message? Set this value to 0 for no limit.

configboolean.name: convert_to_related
configboolean.desc: When composing a message in HTML mode, should we download the data for any images contained in the message and directly attach to the message? This is highly recommended as the image data may not otherwise be available when the recipient views the message in the future. This should be turned off for servers that are firewalled or otherwise have limited Internet connectivity.

configinteger.name: reply_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total size of text (in bytes) to use when replying or forwarding a message. Set this value to 0 for no limit.

configinteger.name: ac_browser
configinteger.desc: For autocompletion of addresses, if the addressbook is below this many entries, the user's address book will be transmitted to the browser if it is below this many entries. This will result in faster lookups and less server load, but requires additional processing on compose creation. Set to 0 to disable.

configinteger.name: ac_threshold
configinteger.desc: When autocompleting addresses in the compose screen, this is the minimum number of characters required before the search is performed on the server.

configboolean.name: use_maillog
configboolean.desc: By default, IMP will keep track of both who a message was sent to and the date it was sent when forwarding, replying, or redirecting a message. This information is stored using the History class provided by Horde. These entries are deleted when the mail is deleted using IMP in an attempt to keep the number of entries to the minimum required - if not deleted the maillog entry will persist forever.

configswitch.name: driver
configswitch.desc: IMP can log all attempts to send messages including who has sent, when, to which recipients. This information might be used to configure message limits or create favourite recipients lists. Enable this feature only if it doesn't violate privacy rules or laws in your country. What storage driver should we use?

configboolean.name: use_tasklist
configboolean.desc: If Nag is installed on the local system, IMP can allow users to add the details of mail messages to a new task. If you do not want this functionality enabled (it will add to server load because the list of available task categories must be generated on every page load), you should disable this checkbox.

configboolean.name: use_notepad
configboolean.desc: If Mnemo is installed on the local system, IMP can allow users to add the details of mail messages to a new note. If you do not want this functionality enabled (it will add to server load because the list of available note categories must be generated on every page load), you should disable this checkbox.

configinteger.name: buffer_pages
configinteger.desc: The number of viewable pages to send to the browser per server access when listing messages.

configinteger.name: viewport_wait
configinteger.desc: How long, in seconds, to wait before displaying an informational message to users that the message list is still being built. Set to 0 to disable messages.

configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in IMP's menu
